title: This Week In React #247: nuqs, Concurrent React, Apollo, shadcn, Streamdown, Fragment Refs, Waku, React-Aria | Expo Launch, Maestro, SPM, Screens, ExecuTorch, BottomSheet, Jest | Zod, Rspack, ESLint, CSS, Bun, Firefox
content:
This Week In React Summary

  • React community is active with new articles and releases.
  • Nx users: Beware of a critical supply chain attack.
  • AG Charts: High-performance, canvas-based charting library for React.
  • nuqs 2.5 released with debounce, standard schema, and more.
  • Next.js 15 and React 19 full-stack development guide.
  • React Context Selectors RFC update: focus shifts to React Compiler and Concurrent Stores.
  • React Types PR: Fragment Refs to enhance React fragments.
  • React PR: new experimental 'name' prop for `
    ` and ``.
  • Next.js PR: unstable 'prefetch' API to control path segment prefetching.
  • New React docs on Custom Elements.
  • Remix v3 will explore a JSX-based component model.
  • React Summit US event in New York, November 18 & 21.
  • Documented React's useTransition and state update reordering.
  • Reflections on the React community and Vercel's incentives.
  • Solution for displaying current time in statically rendered React pages.
  • Managing toast notifications globally with Tanstack Query.
  • First impressions of React Server Components in React Router.
  • Overview of React Concurrent Features.
  • Guide to unlocking Web Workers with React.
  • Tutorial: Build a modern blog with React 19 and Strapi 5.
  • Apollo Client 4.0: framework-agnostic, smaller, unified error handling, better TS support.
  • Streamdown: drop-in replacement for react-markdown for AI streaming.
  • Waku releases: Vite RSC plugin, Slice Components API.
  • shadcn CLI 3.0: namespaced registries, search, improved error handling.
  • React Aria August 25 release: Popover anim, GridListSection, autocomplete.
  • Preact 11 beta: better hydration, default refs forwarding.
  • Video: Better Auth with Next.js by Alex Booker.
  • Video: TanStack Devtools in under 10 minutes by Alem Tuzlak.
  • Video: Why every dev should avoid React by Theo.
  • Video: AI SDK Version 5 on TanStack Start! by Jack Herrington.
  • Video: The Wrong Way to Optimize Performance in React by Cosden Solutions.
  • Podcast: Concurrent Rendering & Actions with Aurora Sharff (PodRocket).
  • Podcast: React beyond the DOM with Erik Rasmussen (PodRocket).
  • Wallaby.js: AI and time travel debugging for TypeScript/JavaScript.
  • React Native: Expo Launch beta for deploying iOS apps.
  • React Universe Conf: "10 Years of React Native and Beyond" panel.
  • React Native progress on Swift Package Manager support.
  • React Native RFC: Split Jest from Core.
  • React Native Proposal: Implementing missing CSS filters on iOS.
  • React Native blog post on Bridging Trace API on Android.
  • React Native blog post on Secure Communication Between Isolated RN Instances.
  • React Native blog post on Creating Development Builds Without Apple Developer Program.
  • React Native blog post on EAS Workflows for CI/CD.
  • React Native blog post on On-Device Text To Speech with AI SDK.
  • React Native blog post on performance tactics.
  • Maestro 2.0: Java 17, GraalJS, Maestro Studio Desktop, Web Testing.
  • Screens 4.15: Tabs improvements.
  • React Native ExecuTorch 0.5: Faster Whisper transcriptions, Zod structured output.
  • React Native Parlant: Build compliant AI chat agents.
  • Bottom Sheet 5.2: useBottomSheetScrollableCreator for LegendList/FlashList.
  • Re.Pack 5.2: Faster Transforms, TS config support, RN 0.80/0.81.
  • React Native Reusables: New CLI, redesigned docs.
  • Video: Expo SDK 54 (beta) new features by notJust.dev.
  • Video: Incremental React Native Adoption in iOS Apps by Callstack.
  • Video: When to use over the air updates by Expo.
  • Video: Drawer Navigation with Nested Tabs using Expo Router by Simon Grimm.
  • Podcast: Catching Up With Maestro by Leland Takamine (RNR 341).
  • Podcast: New Arch, AI Impact, and the Next Wave of RN Innovation with Jamon Holmgren (Rocket Ship 79).
  • Other: Visual introduction to Big O notation.
  • Other: Migrating Rush.js monorepo to Node type stripping.
  • Other: Rolling the Dice with CSS random().
  • Other: 5 Useful CSS functions using the new @function rule.
  • ESLint 9.34: Multithread Linting for significant speed improvements.
  • Zod 4.1: Codecs, bi-directional transformations with encode()/decode().
  • Rspack 1.5: Faster watchers, optimizations, browser support, Rslint announced.
  • Bun 1.2.21: Unified Bun.SQL client, YAML support, Bun.secrets.
  • Firefox 142.0: URLPattern API, scheduler API.
